intro: Hexadenia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited hexadenia, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its thick, woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. Its showy, five-petaled flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in spring. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
